4887 - Search - KB Home, Oklo, eToro, Boeing: After-hours newsmakersHere are some of the companies making headlines after the market close on Monday, March 24. KB Home (KBH) shares fell sharply after the homebuilder reported earnings that fell short of estimates and lowered its full-year revenue outlook. Shares of Oklo (OKLO) slipped after reporting 2024 full-year results. eToro filed for its initial public offering. It has selected to list on the Nasdaq with the ticker ETOR. The Wall Street Journal is reporting that Boeing is looking to withdraw from an agreement it made with the Justice Department to plead guilty in relation to a case in which the aerospace giant is accused of deceiving regulators ahead of two deadly 737 MAX crashes. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend here.
